docs.snippet: The five months in 2005 that the Senate took to decide whether John Bolton should go to the United Nations is the only extensive examination of his record.

headline.print_headline: Bolton Senate Battle  Reveals a Fiery Man Seen as Unchanged
headline.main: ‘Kiss Up, Kick Down’: Those Recalling Bolton’s U.N. Confirmation Process Say He Hasn’t Changed

docs.snippet: A proposed policy would bar the E.P.A. from considering research that doesn't release its raw data for review, blocking some significant work.

headline.main: The E.P.A. Says It Wants Research Transparency. Scientists See an Attack on Science.

docs.snippet: The dark truth of Davos is that it’s booooring.
Diplomacy between the United States and North Korea has gone through familiar cycles of long stagnation, followed by brief bursts of hope, and then inevitable disappointment.

headline.main: With U.S. and North Korea, a Repeated History of Hope and Disappointment

docs.snippet: Facing withering criticism from a Senate subcommittee, the secretary of housing and urban development followed the advice of his aides, who in recent days have urged him to apologize for the purchase.

headline.print_headline: Carson Backs Down On Purchase Of Furniture
headline.main: ‘I Take Responsibility,’ Carson Says of $31,000 Furniture Purchase

docs.snippet: President Trump’s son-in-law wants to overhaul the penal system, but the attorney general is bitterly opposed. That has set the scene for a highly personal battle inside the White House.

headline.main: Listen to ‘The Daily’: The Prison Problem

docs.snippet: Conor Lamb, a Democrat, narrowly won a House special election in a Pennsylvania district that President Trump won by 20 percentage points in 2016.

headline.main: Conor Lamb Tops G.O.P. Rival in Pennsylvania

docs.snippet: Senator Robert Menendez, a Democrat of New Jersey, officially announced he is running again, months after the corruption charges against him were dropped.

headline.main: After a Year of Turmoil, Menendez Announces He Is Seeking Re-Election

docs.snippet: Mr. Kelly, President Trump’s chief of staff, backed up the F.B.I. director’s statement that information about Mr. Porter had been delivered to the White House last March.

headline.print_headline: Kelly Admits Mishandling Allegations About Aide
headline.main: John Kelly Acknowledges He Mishandled Accusations About Rob Porter

docs.snippet: A property once owned by President Donald Trump and Ivana Trump is back on the market for $45 million.

headline.print_headline: Trump's Former Home With Ivana Listed for $45 Million
headline.main: Trump's Former Home With Ivana Listed for $45 Million
